intro: Acourtia mexiae, commonly known as the Mexican acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, mat-forming shrub with narrow, grayish-green leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Acourtia mexiae is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
